thread.title: ‘So misleading’: Gun control crowd triggered by headlines about House rolling back background checks
thread.title_full: ‘So misleading’: Gun control crowd triggered by headlines about House rolling back background checks

author: Brett T.
title: ‘So misleading’: Gun control crowd triggered by headlines about House rolling back background checks
text:
The headlines all seem to be similarly vague: BREAKING: US House of Representatives has voted to roll back background checks for gun ownership 
— The Int'l Spectator (@spectatorindex) February 2, 2017 House strikes down Obama-era regulation that blocked gun sales to mentally ill https://t.co/QCuVgpudHb pic.twitter.com/WphohxoFl4 
— The Hill (@thehill) February 2, 2017 
Former Hillary Clinton spokesperson Jesse Lehrich quoted a passage from USA TODAY to spread the news that the House had voted explicitly to allow schizophrenics to buy firearms. NEW RULE: Don't pass laws *explicitly* allowing schizophrenics to buy guns & then lecture me on national security. https://t.co/xNLVxHuBQj pic.twitter.com/EXu8zUEKvX 
— Jesse Lehrich (@JesseLehrich) February 2, 2017 
Not surprisingly, the NRA wasn’t happy with the way the vote was being portrayed, and the organization even called out Sen. Dianne Feinstein specifically. Senate may vote today to weaken background checks on gun purchases. Call your Senator to oppose this change—ensure your voice is heard! 
— Sen Dianne Feinstein (@SenFeinstein) February 2, 2017 You are a sitting senator. Shouldn't you make sure your tweets are accurate? https://t.co/3nsezAx0Rv 
— NRA (@NRA) February 2, 2017 
Friction between the NRA and Democrats in Congress is nothing new, but something’s going on here. Obviously, there’s more to the story than Congress voting to weaken background checks. . @NRA says #gunviolence is a #mentalhealth issue but is fighting to make it easier ppl with said issue to get guns?? https://t.co/RoJr7V52ir 
— Intently. (@weareintently) February 2, 2017 
Amanda Carey Elliott does social media for the NRA. This @USATODAY headline is incredibly misleading. MANY reasons why SS recipients would designate a fiduciary…not only "mentally impaired" https://t.co/a0rmwqUulo
